metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: JavaScript modules allow you to break up your code into separate files.
content.html: JavaScript modules allow you to break up your code into separate files.

content.text: This makes it easier to maintain the code-base.
content.html: This makes it easier to maintain the code-base.

content.text: ES Modules rely on the import and export statements.
content.html: ES Modules rely on the import and export statements.

content.text: You can export a function or variable from any file.
content.html: You can export a function or variable from any file.

content.text: Let us create a file named person.js , and fill it with the things we want to export.
content.html: Let us create a file named person.js, and fill it with the things we want to export.

content.text: There are two types of exports: Named and Default.
content.html: There are two types of exports: Named and Default.

content.text: You can create named exports two ways. In-line individually, or all at once at the bottom.
content.html: You can create named exports two ways. In-line individually, or all at once at the bottom.

content.code:
export

const
name
=

"Jesse"


export

const
age
=

40
content.code_html:
export const name = "Jesse"
export const age = 40

content.text: Let us create another file, named message.js , and use it for demonstrating default export.
content.html: Let us create another file, named message.js, and use it for demonstrating default export.

content.text: You can only have one default export in a file.
content.html: You can only have one default export in a file.

content.code:
const

message

=

(
)

=>

{


const
name
=

"Jesse"
;


const
age
=

40
;


return
name
+

' is '

+
age
+

'years old.'
;


}
;



export

default
message
;
content.code_html:
const message = () => {
  const name = "Jesse";
  const age = 40;
  return name + ' is ' + age + 'years old.';
};

export default message;

content.text: You can import modules into a file in two ways, based on if they are named exports or default exports.
content.html: You can import modules into a file in two ways, based on if they are named exports or default exports.

content.text: Named exports must be destructured using curly braces. Default exports do not.
content.html: Named exports must be destructured using curly braces. Default exports do not.

content.code_html: import { name, age } from "./person.js";
import message from "./message.js";
